review: I ordered the Fire TV Stick in early December 2014, on as whim, as a birthday gift to myself.  When it first arrived I found it to be easy to install, useful and easy to use.  I don't watch a lot of TV preferring to read but I do like to have the option to watch shows from Amazon and other sources.  I also have a 3rd generation Roku box but like the interface of the Fire stick better, especially the search function.  I live in a rural area and am limited to 1.5 Mbs DSL for Internet access, this limitation can cause buffering issues but with patience TV shows and movies in SD are watchable, HD material can be a bit problematic.  In February 2015 my Fire Stick developed an odd problem, none of my Amazon content is available but other sources of video content work as expected, including "Sting TV" "Hulu" "YouTube" "Ultraviolet" and the like.  My two year old Roku can access all my of my content including Amazon.  I worked my way through the FAQ suggestion to trouble shoot my problem with no improvement.  I suspect the issue is tied to my low bandwidth speed. I plan on giving  the Fire Stick to my son he lives in the city and has 30 Mbs Internet access so he may be able to use it for his Amazon media, if not then into the recycle system it goes life is too short to sweat the small stuff.
